stanza.line: Devouring Time blunt thou the lionpaws
And make the earth devour her own sweet brood
Pluck the keen teeth from the fierce tigerjaws
And burn the long lived phoenix in her blood
Make glad and sorry seasons as thou fleet
And do whateer thou wilt swift footed Time
To the wide world and all her fading sweets
But I forbid thee one most heinous crime
O carve not with thy hours my love fairbrow
Nor draw no lines there with thine antiquepen
Him in thy course untainted doallow
Yet do thy worst old Time despite thy wrong
My love shall in my verse ever live young
